page.title: 01TREMATON & ST.ERNEY
page.content: This area of{S.East Cornwall}is characterized by the scattered farms and rural lifestyle of the community. There are few amenities beyond the occasional bus service and solitary rail link. Much of the land is used for the production of{silage}for winter animal feed, or as rough grazing. A number of disused{quarries litter the area, testifying to a more active past life. The rivers{Lynher}and{Tiddy}pass through on their way to a confluence near the only sizeable villages of {St.Germans}and{Port Elliot.}This "St.Germans or Lynher" river eventually joins the{Tamar}river, historic boundary between Cornwall and the rest of England, on its way to the {English Channel}at{Plymouth}and Saltash.
